column4: Has anyone had anyproblems mounting USB harddrives in UBuntu??
My harddrive is now automounting when I plug it into my laptop. Anyone know how to fix this problem?
*not
use fdisk -l to find out
probably -- can you mount it at the command line?
what does this give you?  pmount-hal /dev/sdb1
the pmount gives me the following http://paste.ubuntu.com/25355/
pmount does not require sudo .. but anyway.  pmount-hal /dev/sdb
Well in the case pmount-hal /dev/sdb returns, Error: could not execute pmount
hrm, that's it?
can you !pastebin the output of fdisk -l
fdisk -l /dev/sdb
Here is fdisk -l http://paste.ubuntu.com/25357/
the thing looks hosed - invalid partition table
unless there is some output that is missing here
try using gpart to guess the tables
you probably need to install it first .. sudo aptitude install gpart
done
what do i need to do after I install it?
errm, not quite sure, never had to use gpart -- but i would start by reading the manpage   man gpart
out of curiosity -- how many partitions did you have on the drive?
Just one
gimme 2 minutes - let's see what i can come up with
sudo gpart -vvd /dev/sdb
